intro: Carallia cuprea, commonly known as the copperleaf, is a species of flowering plant in the family Violaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its striking copper-colored leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, violet-like flowers that bloom in clusters. Carallia cuprea is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and relatively easy care requirements.
